briefdescription.para: Use default value defined at upper level.
AVPF is disabled.
AVPF is enabled.
Enum describing RTP AVPF activation modes.
No media encryption is used.
Use SRTP media encryption.
Use ZRTP media encryption.
Use DTLS media encryption.
Enum describing type of media encryption types.

The LinphoneVideoDefinition object represents a video definition, eg.

detaileddescription.para: its width and its height.

briefdescription.para: Structure describing policy regarding video streams establishments.
Structure describing policy regarding video streams establishments.
Object representing an RTP payload type.
Get the native window handle of the video window, casted as an unsigned long.
Set the native video window id where the video is to be displayed.

detaileddescription.para: For MacOS, Linux, Windows: if not set or 0 a window will be automatically created, unless the special id -1 is given.

briefdescription.para: Enables or disable echo cancellation for this call.
Returns TRUE if echo cancellation is enabled.
Enables or disable echo limiter for this call.
Returns TRUE if echo limiter is enabled.
Use to enable multicast rtp for audio stream.

listitem.para:
If enabled, outgoing calls put a multicast address from linphone_core_get_video_multicast_addr into audio cline. In case of outgoing call audio stream is sent to this multicast address. For incoming calls behavior is unchanged.
params
LinphoneCallParams
yesno
if yes, subsequent calls will propose multicast ip set by linphone_core_set_audio_multicast_addr

briefdescription.para: Use to get multicast state of audio stream.

simplesect.para: true if subsequent calls will propose multicast ip set by linphone_core_set_audio_multicast_addr

briefdescription.para: Use to enable multicast rtp for video stream.

detaileddescription.para:
If enabled, outgoing calls put a multicast address from linphone_core_get_video_multicast_addr into video cline. In case of outgoing call video stream is sent to this multicast address. For incoming calls behavior is unchanged.
params
LinphoneCallParams
yesno
if yes, subsequent outgoing calls will propose multicast ip set by linphone_core_set_video_multicast_addr

briefdescription.para: Use to get multicast state of video stream.

simplesect.para: true if subsequent calls will propose multicast ip set by linphone_core_set_video_multicast_addr

briefdescription.para: Use to enable real time text following rfc4103.

detaileddescription.para:
If enabled, outgoing calls put a m=text line in SDP offer .
params
LinphoneCallParams
yesno
if yes, subsequent outgoing calls will propose rtt

briefdescription.para: Use to get real time text following rfc4103.

simplesect.para: returns true if call rtt is activated.

briefdescription.para: Send the specified dtmf.

xrefdescription.para: Use linphone_call_send_dtmf instead. This function only works during calls. The dtmf is automatically played to the user.

parameterdescription.para: The dtmf name specified as a char, such as '0', '#' etc...

briefdescription.para: Sets maximum available download bandwidth This is IP bandwidth, in kbit/s.

detaileddescription.para: This information is used signaled to other parties during calls (within SDP messages) so that the remote end can have sufficient knowledge to properly configure its audio & video codec output bitrate to not overflow available bandwidth.

parameterdescription.para: the bandwidth in kbits/s, 0 for infinite

briefdescription.para: Sets maximum available upload bandwidth This is IP bandwidth, in kbit/s.

detaileddescription.para: This information is used by liblinphone together with remote side available bandwidth signaled in SDP messages to properly configure audio & video codec's output bitrate.

parameterdescription.para: the bandwidth in kbits/s, 0 for infinite

briefdescription.para: Sets expected available upload bandwidth This is IP bandwidth, in kbit/s.

detaileddescription.para: This information is used by liblinphone together with remote side available bandwidth signaled in SDP messages to properly configure audio & video codec's output bitrate.

parameterdescription.para: the bandwidth in kbits/s, 0 for infinite

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the maximum available download bandwidth.

detaileddescription.para: This value was set by linphone_core_set_download_bandwidth().

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the maximum available upload bandwidth.

detaileddescription.para: This value was set by linphone_core_set_upload_bandwidth().

briefdescription.para: Enable adaptive rate control.

detaileddescription.para: Adaptive rate control consists in using RTCP feedback provided information to dynamically control the output bitrate of the audio and video encoders, so that we can adapt to the network conditions and available bandwidth. Control of the audio encoder is done in case of audio-only call, and control of the video encoder is done for audio & video calls. Adaptive rate control feature is enabled by default.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether adaptive rate control is enabled.
Sets adaptive rate algorithm.

detaileddescription.para:
It will be used for each new calls starting from now. Calls already started will not be updated.
lc
the core
algorithm
the adaptive rate control algorithm. Currently two values are supported: 'advanced', which is the default value, or 'basic'.

briefdescription.para: Returns which adaptive rate algorithm is currently configured for future calls.
Set audio packetization time linphone expects to receive from peer.

detaileddescription.para: A value of zero means that ptime is not specified.

briefdescription.para: Get audio packetization time linphone expects to receive from peer.

detaileddescription.para: A value of zero means that ptime is not specified.

briefdescription.para: Set audio packetization time linphone will send (in absence of requirement from peer) A value of 0 stands for the current codec default packetization time.
Set audio packetization time linphone will send (in absence of requirement from peer) A value of 0 stands for the current codec default packetization time.
Set the SIP transport timeout.

parameterdescription.para: The SIP transport timeout in milliseconds.

briefdescription.para: Get the SIP transport timeout.

simplesect.para: The SIP transport timeout in milliseconds.

briefdescription.para: Enable or disable DNS SRV resolution.

parameterdescription.para: TRUE to enable DNS SRV resolution, FALSE to disable it.

briefdescription.para: Tells whether DNS SRV resolution is enabled.

simplesect.para: TRUE if DNS SRV resolution is enabled, FALSE if disabled.

briefdescription.para: Enable or disable DNS search (use of local domain if the fully qualified name did return results).

parameterdescription.para: TRUE to enable DNS search, FALSE to disable it.

briefdescription.para: Tells whether DNS search (use of local domain if the fully qualified name did return results) is enabled.

simplesect.para: TRUE if DNS search is enabled, FALSE if disabled.

briefdescription.para: Forces liblinphone to use the supplied list of dns servers, instead of system's ones.

parameterdescription.para: A list of const char * objects. const char * A list of strings containing the IP addresses of DNS servers to be used. Setting to NULL restores default behaviour, which is to use the DNS server list provided by the system. The list is copied internally.

briefdescription.para: Return the list of the available audio payload types.

simplesect.para: A list of LinphonePayloadType objects. LinphonePayloadType A freshly allocated list of the available payload types. The list must be destroyed with bctbx_list_free() after usage. The elements of the list haven't to be unref.

briefdescription.para: Redefine the list of the available payload types.

parameterdescription.para: A list of LinphonePayloadType objects. LinphonePayloadType The new list of payload types. The core does not take ownership on it.

briefdescription.para: Returns the list of available audio codecs.

detaileddescription.para:
lc
The LinphoneCore object
A list of OrtpPayloadType objects. OrtpPayloadType This list is unmodifiable. The ->data field of the bctbx_list_t points a PayloadType structure holding the codec information. It is possible to make copy of the list with bctbx_list_copy() in order to modify it (such as the order of codecs).

briefdescription.para: Sets the list of audio codecs.

parameterdescription.para: A list of OrtpPayloadType objects. OrtpPayloadType

simplesect.para: 0 The list is taken by the LinphoneCore thus the application should not free it. This list is made of struct PayloadType describing the codec parameters.

briefdescription.para: Return the list of the available video payload types.

simplesect.para: A list of LinphonePayloadType objects. LinphonePayloadType A freshly allocated list of the available payload types. The list must be destroyed with bctbx_list_free() after usage. The elements of the list haven't to be unref.

parameterdescription.para: A list of LinphonePayloadType objects. LinphonePayloadType The new list of codecs. The core does not take ownership on it.

The LinphoneCore object
A list of OrtpPayloadType objects. OrtpPayloadType This list is unmodifiable. The ->data field of the bctbx_list_t points a PayloadType structure holding the codec information. It is possible to make copy of the list with bctbx_list_copy() in order to modify it (such as the order of codecs).

detaileddescription.para:
lc
The LinphoneCore object
codecs
A list of OrtpPayloadType objects. OrtpPayloadType
0 The list is taken by the LinphoneCore thus the application should not free it. This list is made of struct PayloadType describing the codec parameters.

briefdescription.para: Returns the list of available text codecs.

detaileddescription.para:
lc
The LinphoneCore object
A list of OrtpPayloadType objects. OrtpPayloadType This list is unmodifiable. The ->data field of the bctbx_list_t points a PayloadType structure holding the codec information. It is possible to make copy of the list with bctbx_list_copy() in order to modify it (such as the order of codecs).

The LinphoneCore object
codecs

briefdescription.para: Tells whether the specified payload type is enabled.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the payload type is enabled, FALSE if disabled.

briefdescription.para: Tells whether the specified payload type represents a variable bitrate codec.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the payload type represents a VBR codec, FALSE if disabled.

briefdescription.para: Set an explicit bitrate (IP bitrate, not codec bitrate) for a given codec, in kbit/s.
Get the bitrate explicitely set with linphone_core_set_payload_type_bitrate().

simplesect.para: bitrate the IP bitrate in kbit/s, or -1 if an error occured.

briefdescription.para: Enable or disable the use of the specified payload type.

parameterdescription.para: The payload type to enable or disable. It can be retrieved using linphone_core_find_payload_type
TRUE to enable the payload type, FALSE to disable it.

simplesect.para: 0 if successful, any other value otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (LinphoneCore *lc, const char *type, int rate, int channels)
memberdef.name: linphone_core_find_payload_type

briefdescription.para: Get payload type from mime type and clock rate.

detaileddescription.para:
This function searches in audio and video codecs for the given payload type name and clockrate.
lc
LinphoneCore object
type
payload mime type (I.E SPEEX, PCMU, VP8)
rate
can be LINPHONE_FIND_PAYLOAD_IGNORE_RATE
channels
number of channels, can be LINPHONE_FIND_PAYLOAD_IGNORE_CHANNELS
Returns NULL if not found. Deprecated
Use linphone_core_get_payload_type() instead.

memberdef.argsstring: (LinphoneCore *lc, const char *type, int rate, int channels)
memberdef.name: linphone_core_get_payload_type

briefdescription.para: Get payload type from mime type and clock rate.

detaileddescription.para:
This function searches in audio and video codecs for the given payload type name and clockrate.
lc
LinphoneCore object
type
payload mime type (I.E SPEEX, PCMU, VP8)
rate
can be LINPHONE_FIND_PAYLOAD_IGNORE_RATE
channels
number of channels, can be LINPHONE_FIND_PAYLOAD_IGNORE_CHANNELS
Returns NULL if not found. If a LinphonePayloadType is returned, it must be released with linphone_payload_type_unref() after using it.
The returned payload type is allocated as a floating reference i.e. the reference counter is initialized to 0.

briefdescription.para: Returns the payload type number assigned for this codec.
Force a number for a payload type.

detaileddescription.para: The LinphoneCore does payload type number assignment automatically. THis function is to be used mainly for tests, in order to override the automatic assignment mechanism.

briefdescription.para: Return TRUE if codec can be used with bandwidth, FALSE else.
Enable or disable the audio adaptive jitter compensation.

parameterdescription.para: TRUE to enable the audio adaptive jitter compensation, FALSE to disable it.

briefdescription.para: Tells whether the audio adaptive jitter compensation is enabled.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the audio adaptive jitter compensation is enabled, FALSE otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns the nominal audio jitter buffer size in milliseconds.

simplesect.para: The nominal audio jitter buffer size in milliseconds

briefdescription.para: Sets the nominal audio jitter buffer size in milliseconds.

detaileddescription.para: The value takes effect immediately for all running and pending calls, if any. A value of 0 disables the jitter buffer.

briefdescription.para: Enable or disable the video adaptive jitter compensation.

parameterdescription.para: TRUE to enable the video adaptive jitter compensation, FALSE to disable it.

briefdescription.para: Tells whether the video adaptive jitter compensation is enabled.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the video adaptive jitter compensation is enabled, FALSE otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns the nominal video jitter buffer size in milliseconds.

simplesect.para: The nominal video jitter buffer size in milliseconds

briefdescription.para: Sets the nominal video jitter buffer size in milliseconds.

detaileddescription.para: The value takes effect immediately for all running and pending calls, if any. A value of 0 disables the jitter buffer.

briefdescription.para: Gets the value of the no-rtp timeout.

detaileddescription.para:
When no RTP or RTCP packets have been received for a while LinphoneCore will consider the call is broken (remote end crashed or disconnected from the network), and thus will terminate the call. The no-rtp timeout is the duration above which the call is considered broken.
lc
LinphoneCore object
The value of the no-rtp timeout in seconds

The upper bound of the audio port range to use

The upper bound of the text port range to use

briefdescription.para: Whenever the liblinphone is playing a ring to advertise an incoming call or ringback of an outgoing call, this function stops the ringing.

detaileddescription.para:
Typical use is to stop ringing when the user requests to ignore the call.
lc
LinphoneCore object

briefdescription.para: Sets the path to a wav file used for ringing.

detaileddescription.para:
The file must be a wav 16bit linear. Local ring is disabled if null.
lc
LinphoneCore object
path
The path to a wav file to be used for ringing

briefdescription.para: Returns the path to the wav file used for ringing.

simplesect.para: The path to the wav file used for ringing

briefdescription.para: Sets the path to a wav file used for ringing back.

detaileddescription.para:
Ringback means the ring that is heard when it's ringing at the remote party. The file must be a wav 16bit linear.
lc
LinphoneCore object
path
The path to a wav file to be used for ringing back

briefdescription.para: Returns the path to the wav file used for ringing back.

simplesect.para: The path to the wav file used for ringing back

briefdescription.para: Specify a ring back tone to be played to far end during incoming calls.

parameterdescription.para: The path to the ring back tone to be played.

briefdescription.para: Get the ring back tone played to far end during incoming calls.
Enable or disable the ring play during an incoming early media call.

parameterdescription.para: A boolean value telling whether to enable ringing during an incoming early media call.

briefdescription.para: Tells whether the ring play is enabled during an incoming early media call.
Enables or disable echo cancellation.

detaileddescription.para:
Value is saved and used for subsequent calls. This actually controls software echo cancellation. If hardware echo cancellation is available, it will be always used and activated for calls, regardless of the value passed to this function. When hardware echo cancellation is available, the software one is of course not activated.
lc
LinphoneCore object
val
A boolean value telling whether echo cancellation is to be enabled or disabled.

briefdescription.para: Returns TRUE if echo cancellation is enabled.

simplesect.para: A boolean value telling whether echo cancellation is enabled or disabled

briefdescription.para: Enables or disable echo limiter.

parameterdescription.para: TRUE to enable echo limiter, FALSE to disable it.

briefdescription.para: Tells whether echo limiter is enabled.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the echo limiter is enabled, FALSE otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Enable or disable the microphone.

parameterdescription.para: TRUE to enable the microphone, FALSE to disable it.

briefdescription.para: Tells whether the microphone is enabled.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the microphone is enabled, FALSE if disabled.

briefdescription.para: Enables video globally.

detaileddescription.para: This function does not have any effect during calls. It just indicates LinphoneCore to initiate future calls with video or not. The two boolean parameters indicate in which direction video is enabled. Setting both to false disables video entirely.

parameterdescription.para: indicates whether video capture is enabled
indicates whether video display should be shown

briefdescription.para: Returns TRUE if either capture or display is enabled, FALSE otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: same as ( linphone_core_video_capture_enabled | linphone_core_video_display_enabled )

briefdescription.para: Enable or disable video capture.

detaileddescription.para:
This function does not have any effect during calls. It just indicates the LinphoneCore to initiate future calls with video capture or not.
lc
LinphoneCore object.
enable
TRUE to enable video capture, FALSE to disable it.

briefdescription.para: Enable or disable video display.

detaileddescription.para:
This function does not have any effect during calls. It just indicates the LinphoneCore to initiate future calls with video display or not.
lc
LinphoneCore object.
enable
TRUE to enable video display, FALSE to disable it.

briefdescription.para: Enable or disable video source reuse when switching from preview to actual video call.

detaileddescription.para: This source reuse is useful when you always display the preview, even before calls are initiated. By keeping the video source for the transition to a real video call, you will smooth out the source close/reopen cycle.

This function does not have any effect durfing calls. It just indicates the LinphoneCore to initiate future calls with video source reuse or not. Also, at the end of a video call, the source will be closed whatsoever for now.
lc
LinphoneCore object
enable
TRUE to enable video source reuse. FALSE to disable it for subsequent calls.

briefdescription.para: Tells whether video capture is enabled.

simplesect.para: TRUE if video capture is enabled, FALSE if disabled.

briefdescription.para: Tells whether video display is enabled.

simplesect.para: TRUE if video display is enabled, FALSE if disabled.

briefdescription.para: Sets the default policy for video.

detaileddescription.para:
This policy defines whether:
video shall be initiated by default for outgoing calls
video shall be accepter by default for incoming calls

briefdescription.para: Get the default policy for video.

detaileddescription.para:
See linphone_core_set_video_policy() for more details.
lc
LinphoneCore object
The video policy being used Deprecated

briefdescription.para: Increment refcount.
Decrement refcount and possibly free the object.

simplesect.para: the user data

Gets the value for the automatically accept video policy.

simplesect.para: whether or not to automatically accept video requests is enabled

briefdescription.para: Gets the value for the automatically initiate video policy.

simplesect.para: whether or not to automatically initiate video calls is enabled

briefdescription.para: Sets the value for the automatically accept video policy.

parameterdescription.para: whether or not to enable automatically accept video requests

briefdescription.para: Sets the value for the automatically initiate video policy.

parameterdescription.para: whether or not to enable automatically initiate video calls

This policy defines whether:
video shall be initiated by default for outgoing calls
video shall be accepted by default for incoming calls

LinphoneCore object

The video policy to use

detaileddescription.para:
See linphone_core_set_video_activation_policy() for more details.

LinphoneCore object
The video policy being used

briefdescription.para: Returns the zero terminated table of supported video resolutions.
Set the preferred video definition for the stream that is captured and sent to the remote party.

detaileddescription.para:
All standard video definitions are accepted on the receive path.
lc
LinphoneCore object
vdef
LinphoneVideoDefinition object

briefdescription.para: Sets the preferred video size.

detaileddescription.para: This applies only to the stream that is captured and sent to the remote party, since we accept all standard video size on the receive path.

briefdescription.para: Set the video definition for the captured (preview) video.

detaileddescription.para:
This method is for advanced usage where a video capture must be set independently of the definition of the stream actually sent through the call. This allows for example to have the preview window in High Definition even if due to bandwidth constraint the sent video definition is small. Using this feature increases the CPU consumption, since a rescaling will be done internally.
lc
LinphoneCore object
vdef
LinphoneVideoDefinition object

briefdescription.para: Sets the video size for the captured (preview) video.

detaileddescription.para: This method is for advanced usage where a video capture must be set independently of the size of the stream actually sent through the call. This allows for example to have the preview window with HD resolution even if due to bandwidth constraint the sent video size is small. Using this feature increases the CPU consumption, since a rescaling will be done internally.

parameterdescription.para: the video resolution choosed for capuring and previewing. It can be (0,0) to not request any specific preview size and let the core optimize the processing.

briefdescription.para: Sets the preview video size by its name.

detaileddescription.para: See linphone_core_set_preview_video_size() for more information about this feature.
Video resolution names are: qcif, svga, cif, vga, 4cif, svga ...

briefdescription.para: Get the definition of the captured video.

simplesect.para: The captured LinphoneVideoDefinition if it was previously set by linphone_core_set_preview_video_definition(), otherwise a 0x0 LinphoneVideoDefinition.

briefdescription.para: Returns video size for the captured video if it was previously set by linphone_core_set_preview_video_size(), otherwise returns a 0,0 size.

simplesect.para: a MSVideoSize

briefdescription.para: Get the effective video definition provided by the camera for the captured video.

detaileddescription.para:
When preview is disabled or not yet started this function returns a 0x0 video definition.
lc
LinphoneCore object
The captured LinphoneVideoDefinition
linphone_core_set_preview_video_definition()

briefdescription.para: Returns the effective video size for the captured video as provided by the camera.

detaileddescription.para:
When preview is disabled or not yet started, this function returns a zeroed video size.
linphone_core_set_preview_video_size()
lc
the core
a MSVideoSize Deprecated
Use linphone_core_get_current_preview_video_definition() instead

briefdescription.para: Get the preferred video definition for the stream that is captured and sent to the remote party.

simplesect.para: The preferred LinphoneVideoDefinition

briefdescription.para: Returns the current preferred video size for sending.
Sets the preferred video size by its name.

detaileddescription.para: This is identical to linphone_core_set_preferred_video_size() except that it takes the name of the video resolution as input. Video resolution names are: qcif, svga, cif, vga, 4cif, svga ...

briefdescription.para: Set the preferred frame rate for video.

detaileddescription.para:
Based on the available bandwidth constraints and network conditions, the video encoder remains free to lower the framerate. There is no warranty that the preferred frame rate be the actual framerate. used during a call. Default value is 0, which means "use encoder's default fps value".
lc
the LinphoneCore
fps
the target frame rate in number of frames per seconds.

briefdescription.para: Returns the preferred video framerate, previously set by linphone_core_set_preferred_framerate().

simplesect.para: frame rate in number of frames per seconds.

briefdescription.para: Call generic OpenGL render for a given core.
Controls video preview enablement.

parameterdescription.para: A boolean value telling whether the video preview is to be shown Video preview refers to the action of displaying the local webcam image to the user while not in call.

briefdescription.para: Tells whether video preview is enabled.

simplesect.para: A boolean value telling whether video preview is enabled

briefdescription.para: Enables or disable self view during calls.

parameterdescription.para: A boolean value telling whether to enable self view Self-view refers to having local webcam image inserted in corner of the video window during calls. This function works at any time, including during calls.

briefdescription.para: Tells whether video self view during call is enabled or not.

simplesect.para: A boolean value telling whether self view is enabled
linphone_core_enable_self_view() for details.

briefdescription.para: Update detection of camera devices.

detaileddescription.para:
Use this function when the application is notified of USB plug events, so that list of available hardwares for video capture is updated.
lc
LinphoneCore object.

briefdescription.para: Gets the list of the available video capture devices.

simplesect.para: An unmodifiable array of strings contanining the names of the available video capture devices that is NULL terminated

parameterdescription.para: The name of the video device to use as returned by linphone_core_get_video_devices()

briefdescription.para: Returns the name of the currently active video device.

simplesect.para: The name of the currently active video device

briefdescription.para: Get the path to the image file streamed when "Static picture" is set as the video device.

simplesect.para: The path to the image file streamed when "Static picture" is set as the video device.

briefdescription.para: Set the frame rate for static picture.

parameterdescription.para: The new frame rate to use for static picture.

briefdescription.para: Get the frame rate for static picture.

simplesect.para: The frame rate used for static picture.

briefdescription.para: Get the native window handle of the video window.

simplesect.para: The native window handle of the video window

briefdescription.para: Set the native video window id where the video is to be displayed.

detaileddescription.para: For MacOS, Linux, Windows: if not set or LINPHONE_VIDEO_DISPLAY_AUTO the core will create its own window, unless the special id LINPHONE_VIDEO_DISPLAY_NONE is given.

briefdescription.para: Get the native window handle of the video preview window.

simplesect.para: The native window handle of the video preview window

briefdescription.para: Set the native window id where the preview video (local camera) is to be displayed.

detaileddescription.para:
This has to be used in conjonction with linphone_core_use_preview_window(). MacOS, Linux, Windows: if not set or zero the core will create its own window, unless the special id -1 is given.
lc
LinphoneCore object
id
The native window id where the preview video is to be displayed

briefdescription.para: Tells the core to use a separate window for local camera preview video, instead of inserting local view within the remote video window.

parameterdescription.para: TRUE to use a separate window, FALSE to insert the preview in the remote video window.

briefdescription.para: Gets the current device orientation.

simplesect.para: The current device orientation

briefdescription.para: Tells the core the device current orientation.

detaileddescription.para:
This can be used by capture filters on mobile devices to select between portrait/landscape mode and to produce properly oriented images. The exact meaning of the value in rotation if left to each device specific implementations. IOS supported values are 0 for UIInterfaceOrientationPortrait and 270 for UIInterfaceOrientationLandscapeRight.
lc
LinphoneCore object
rotation
The orientation to use

briefdescription.para: Ask the core to stream audio from and to files, instead of using the soundcard.

parameterdescription.para: A boolean value asking to stream audio from and to files or not.

briefdescription.para: Gets whether linphone is currently streaming audio from and to files, rather than using the soundcard.

simplesect.para: A boolean value representing whether linphone is streaming audio from and to files or not.

briefdescription.para: Get the wav file that is played when putting somebody on hold, or when files are used instead of soundcards (see linphone_core_set_use_files()).

detaileddescription.para:
The file is a 16 bit linear wav file.
lc
LinphoneCore object
The path to the file that is played when putting somebody on hold.

briefdescription.para: Sets a wav file to be played when putting somebody on hold, or when files are used instead of soundcards (see linphone_core_set_use_files()).

detaileddescription.para:
The file must be a 16 bit linear wav file.
lc
LinphoneCore object
file
The path to the file to be played when putting somebody on hold.

briefdescription.para: Get the wav file where incoming stream is recorded, when files are used instead of soundcards (see linphone_core_set_use_files()).

detaileddescription.para:
This feature is different from call recording (linphone_call_params_set_record_file()) The file is a 16 bit linear wav file.
lc
LinphoneCore object
The path to the file where incoming stream is recorded.

briefdescription.para: Sets a wav file where incoming stream is to be recorded, when files are used instead of soundcards (see linphone_core_set_use_files()).

detaileddescription.para:
This feature is different from call recording (linphone_call_params_set_record_file()) The file will be a 16 bit linear wav file.
lc
LinphoneCore object
file
The path to the file where incoming stream is to be recorded.

parameterdescription.para: Duration in ms, -1 means play until next further call to linphone_core_stop_dtmf()

briefdescription.para: Stops playing a dtmf started by linphone_core_play_dtmf().

Sets the maximum transmission unit size in bytes.

detaileddescription.para:
This information is useful for sending RTP packets. Default value is 1500.

LinphoneCore object

The MTU in bytes

briefdescription.para: Choose the media encryption policy to be used for RTP packets.

simplesect.para: 0 if successful, any other value otherwise.

simplesect.para: The media encryption policy being used.

briefdescription.para: Get behaviour when encryption parameters negociation fails on outgoing call.

simplesect.para: TRUE means the call will fail; FALSE means an INVITE will be resent with encryption disabled.

briefdescription.para: Define behaviour when encryption parameters negociation fails on outgoing call.

parameterdescription.para: If set to TRUE call will fail; if set to FALSE will resend an INVITE with encryption disabled.

This is for advanced users of the library.

simplesect.para: the supported formats, typically 'wav' and 'mkv'

briefdescription.para: Returns whether a specific file format is supported.
Enable RTCP feedback (also known as RTP/AVPF profile).

detaileddescription.para:
Setting LinphoneAVPFDefault is equivalent to LinphoneAVPFDisabled. This setting can be overriden per LinphoneProxyConfig with linphone_proxy_config_set_avpf_mode(). The value set here is used for calls placed or received out of any proxy configured, or if the proxy config is configured with LinphoneAVPFDefault.
lc
LinphoneCore object
mode
The AVPF mode to use.

briefdescription.para: Return AVPF enablement.

detaileddescription.para:
See linphone_core_set_avpf_mode() .
lc
LinphoneCore object
The current AVPF mode

briefdescription.para: Set the avpf report interval in seconds.

detaileddescription.para:
This value can be overriden by the proxy config using linphone_proxy_config_set_avpf_rr_interval().
lc
LinphoneCore object
interval
The report interval in seconds

briefdescription.para: Return the avpf report interval in seconds.

simplesect.para: The current AVPF report interval in seconds

briefdescription.para: Use to enable multicast rtp for audio stream.

detaileddescription.para:
If enabled, outgoing calls put a multicast address from linphone_core_get_video_multicast_addr into audio cline. In case of outgoing call audio stream is sent to this multicast address. For incoming calls behavior is unchanged.
core
LinphoneCore
yesno
if yes, subsequent calls will propose multicast ip set by linphone_core_set_audio_multicast_addr

briefdescription.para: Use to get multicast state of audio stream.

simplesect.para: true if subsequent calls will propose multicast ip set by linphone_core_set_audio_multicast_addr

briefdescription.para: Use to enable multicast rtp for video stream.

detaileddescription.para:
If enabled, outgoing calls put a multicast address from linphone_core_get_video_multicast_addr into video cline. In case of outgoing call video stream is sent to this multicast address. For incoming calls behavior is unchanged.
core
LinphoneCore
yesno
if yes, subsequent outgoing calls will propose multicast ip set by linphone_core_set_video_multicast_addr

briefdescription.para: Use to get multicast state of video stream.

simplesect.para: true if subsequent calls will propose multicast ip set by linphone_core_set_video_multicast_addr

briefdescription.para: Set the network simulator parameters.

detaileddescription.para:
Liblinphone has the capabability of simulating the effects of a network (latency, lost packets, jitter, max bandwidth). Please refer to the oRTP documentation for the meaning of the parameters of the OrtpNetworkSimulatorParams structure. This function has effect for future calls, but not for currently running calls, though this behavior may be changed in future versions.
Due to design of network simulation in oRTP, simulation is applied independently for audio and video stream. This means for example that a bandwidth limit of 250kbit/s will have no effect on an audio stream running at 40kbit/s while a videostream targetting 400kbit/s will be highly affected.
lc
the LinphoneCore
params
the parameters used for the network simulation.
0 if successful, -1 otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the previously set network simulation parameters.

simplesect.para: a OrtpNetworkSimulatorParams structure.

Controlling media parameters.

detaileddescription.para:
Call using rtp multicast addresses are supported for both audio and video with some limitations. Limitations are, no stun, no ice, no encryption.
Incoming call with multicast address are automatically accepted. The called party switches in a media receive only mode.
Outgoing call willing to send media to a multicast address can activate multicast using linphone_core_enable_video_multicast() or linphone_core_enable_audio_multicast(). The calling party switches in a media listen send only mode.
